title: Leading in Service Exports
description: In 2023, Papua New Guinea's communications, computer, and other services accounted for 95.93% of its service exports, highlighting its strong presence in the global service export market.

title: High Rural Population
description: As of 2023, 86.28% of Papua New Guinea's population resides in rural areas, indicating a predominantly rural demographic.

title: Low Urbanization Rate
description: In 2023, only 13.72% of Papua New Guinea's population lived in urban areas, reflecting a low level of urbanization.

title: Frequent Power Outages
description: In 2015, firms in Papua New Guinea experienced an average of 41.9 power outages per month, one of the highest rates globally.

title: Widespread Electrical Outages
description: 97.7% of firms in Papua New Guinea reported experiencing electrical outages in 2015, indicating significant challenges in power reliability.

title: High Informal Payments
description: In 2015, 89.3% of firms in Papua New Guinea reported making informal payments to public officials, highlighting corruption issues.

title: Significant Losses from Theft and Vandalism
description: 61.5% of firms in Papua New Guinea experienced losses due to theft and vandalism in 2015, indicating security challenges.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio
description: In 2016, the pupil-teacher ratio in upper secondary education was 83.26, one of the highest globally, suggesting overcrowded classrooms.

title: Limited Hospital Beds
description: In 2019, Papua New Guinea had only 0.17 hospital beds per 1,000 people, one of the lowest ratios worldwide, indicating limited healthcare infrastructure.

title: Minimal Personal Transfers
description: In 2023, personal transfers to Papua New Guinea amounted to $143,486, one of the lowest globally, reflecting limited remittance inflows.

title: Low Stock Market Activity
description: In 2017, the turnover ratio of domestic shares in Papua New Guinea was 0.0535, indicating low stock market activity.

title: Minimal Aid from Sweden
description: In 2022, Papua New Guinea received $10,000 in bilateral aid from Sweden, one of the lowest amounts globally.

title: Strong Focus on Formal Training
description: 73.7% of firms in Papua New Guinea offered formal training to their employees in 2015, indicating a commitment to workforce development.
